Question 36) Fight: unpredictable body practice, characterized by a particular state of contact, which enables two or more people to confront themselves in a constant exchange of offensive and/or defensive actions, governed by rules, with the mutual objective of a personifi mobile target in the opponent.
GOMES, M. S. P. et al. Teaching of struggles: from conditional principles to situational groups. According to the text, we can identify an approach to the struggles in physical education classes when the teacher makes a proposal involving
A) Intense body contact between the student and his opponent.
B) strife among students who are assaulting physically.
C) Body confrontation in which the winners are previously identified.
D) Intentional bodily combat with regulated actions between opponents.
E) conflict resolved by students through previously established rules.
